title: Setting Up Windows Server 2025
author: Tyler
intro: Setting up a Windows Server is a fundamental task for any IT professional. This guide walks through the basic setup and configuration of Windows Server 2025.
We'll cover initial installation, Active Directory setup, and basic role configuration.

steps.title: Prepare for Installation
steps.text: Download Windows Server 2025 ISO, prepare installation media, and ensure your hardware meets the requirements.

steps.title: Initial Server Installation
steps.text: Boot from installation media, select installation type (Desktop/Core), configure partitions, and complete the base OS install.

steps.title: Post-Installation Configuration
steps.text: Set computer name, configure network settings, and install Windows Updates.

steps.title: Install Required Roles
steps.text: Use Server Manager to add roles like Active Directory Domain Services, DNS, and DHCP as needed.

steps.title: Configure Active Directory
steps.text: Run AD DS configuration wizard, set up your first domain, and create organizational units.

body: Remember to document all configuration changes and keep your server updated.
This is a basic template - customize the setup based on your organization's needs.
